title: H.S. football notes: Oct. 26, 2015
text:
H.S. football notes: Oct. 26, 2015 October 26, 2015 Last updated: Monday, October 26, 2015, 1:21 AM The Record Print 
* Glen Rock junior DB Tim Ray has an interception in four straight games. Senior WR Tommy Pulzello also caught six passes for 95 yards in the Panthers’ 33-13 victory over Harrison, which is Glen Rock’s sixth straight win. 
* Senior DE Jordan Hunter made a big impact for Hackensack in its comeback at Ridgewood. Hunter had 12 tackles, including one for a loss, and a sack during the Comets’ 28-27 victory. 
* Keep an eye on Hasbrouck Heights senior RB Seth Scalvino. His 73-yard TD run gave the Aviators a 21-14 win against Cresskill. He has rushed for a team-high 672 yards and nine TDs in seven games. 
* Kinnelon won its first game of the season and snapped a six-game losing streak by beating Whippany Park, 52-27. Junior QB Jon Toye completed 15 of 25 passes for 389 yards and six TDs for the Colts, and didn’t throw an interception. Junior TE/OLB Seamus Nelson had three catches for 77 yards and three TDs, made nine tackles and intercepted a pass for Kinnelon. Senior RB/WR Chris Hausler played a key role in the win as well: He had nine catches for 193 yards and two TDs, and 21 carries for 116 yards and a TD. 
* Bergen Catholic sophomore QB Johnny Langan was impressive in his first varsity start. The Wayne resident threw for 157 yards and two TDs, including the game-winner in overtime, and rushed for 91 yards in the Crusaders’ 16-13 win over St. Joseph. 
* Lodi senior QB Steven Villa produced his third 200-yard rushing game of the season in a 42-35 loss to Palisades Park/Leonia. Villa gained 246 yards and scored a TD on 27 carries to up his season totals to 1,158 yards and 10 TDs on 134 carries. He also completed five of seven passes for 80 yards and a TD. 
* Despite its 33-32 loss at Waldwick/Midland Park, Manchester (3-4) has a chance to qualify for the playoffs for the first time since 2003. The Falcons need Lyndhurst to lose to Pompton Lakes and Dover to lose to Hanover Park on Friday night, and must beat Elmwood Park on Saturday to secure the eighth spot in North 2, Group 2. 
* Senior RBs Axel Fuentes and Anthony Ramos combined for 324 rushing yards for North Bergen in the Bruins’ 27-24 loss to Bayonne. Fuentes led North Bergen with 166 yards and a TD on 17 attempts. Ramos carried 16 times for 158 yards and a TD. 
* Senior RB Zach DeNike has 780 rushing yards and nine TDs, despite that he has carried just 81 times for NV/Old Tappan. He ran for 110 yards and three TDs on 16 attempts in the Golden Knights’ 44-21 win over Northern Highlands. 
* Senior RB Kevin Copper went over 100 yards for the third time in seven games for Passaic Tech during a 19-7 win at Clifton. Copper finished with 115 yards and a TD on 19 carries to improve his season totals to 92 carries for 626 yards and seven TDs. 
* Pompton Lakes senior DL Ryan Gosiker produced three sacks in the Cardinals’ 20-14 loss to New Milford. 
* Pequannock senior QB Tommy Crooks threw for 163 yards and rushed for 70 yards and three TDs in the Golden Panthers’ 28-7 win at Newton — their fifth in a row. 
* Ramapo is getting good production from senior DE Ryan Soodsma and junior DE Chris Ditommaso. They have four sacks apiece through seven games and have combined for 45 tackles. 
* Senior RB Tyshaun Horton scored five TDs and a two-point conversion for Wallington in a 40-20 win over Emerson. Horton tied the school record for most TDs in a game and established a school record for individual points in a game (32). 
* Wayne Hills senior RB Luca Grave is making the most of his opportunities this season. Grave gained 106 yards and scored two TDs on 14 carries to help the Patriots beat Paramus, 28-7. He has carried 99 times for 891 yards and 14 TDs in seven games. Wayne Hills senior DE Leyshawn Askew had 10 tackles, including two for losses, against Paramus. Askew has committed to Massachusetts. 
* Wayne Valley senior TE Ryan Monteyne continued to produce during the Indians’ come-from-behind 29-25 victory over Lakeland. Monteyne caught three passes for 59 yards and a TD, as well as a two-point conversion. He has 18 catches for 358 yards and seven TDs, including at least one TD catch in six of Wayne Valley’s seven games. 
* Westwood senior TE Ryan Lawton is turning it on down the stretch. He has 13 catches for 165 yards and four TDs in his last two games, which has helped the Cardinals pick up significant ground in the North 1, Group 2 playoff race. 
* Wood-Ridge senior LB Josh Paez’s eight tackles in a 28-22 win against Queen of Peace increased his team-leading total to 73 through seven games. He also picked off a pass for a second straight game, which he returned 35 yards for a TD. 
— Mark J. Czerwinski, Keith Idec, Jim McConville and Ed Mills
